result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 08:30 AM Defendant, George H. Bruce in court, Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petition filed. Discussion held. Court appoints Atty Mike Devitt at rate of $100 today and then $100/biweekly comm 3/11 through wage assignment.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

09:09 AM Defendant, George H. Bruce in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. Review hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
